com.meti.io

Class Client

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.meti.io.Client

  • public class Client
extends java.lang.Object
    A Client object specifies a unique handling to transfer information across sockets.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructs a new Client specified by the socket parameter.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Client

        public Client(java.net.Socket socket)
       throws java.io.IOException

        Constructs a new Client specified by the socket parameter. Then constructs both an ObjectInputStream and ObjectOutputStream

        Parameters:
        socket - The socket
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown during construction of either stream
        See Also:
        ObjectInputStream, ObjectOutputStream

    • Method Detail

      • readAll

        public <T extends java.io.Serializable> java.util.List<T> readAll(java.lang.Class<T> c)
                                                           throws java.io.IOException,
                                                                  java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

        Reads a defined number of objects specified by an incoming integer, which represents the size. Then returns an ArrayList composed of all objects read of type T. Uses read(Class)

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the object to receive
        Parameters:
        c - The class with type T
        Returns:
        The objects read of type T
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - See read(Class)
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - See read(Class)

      • read

        public <T> T read(java.lang.Class<T> c)
           throws java.io.IOException,
                  java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

        Reads a single object specified by T. The parameter c must be specified the same as type T. If the input buffer contains an object of type T, that object will be returned instead of reading a new one. If the input buffer does not contain an object of type T, then the ObjectInputStream will read a new object. Any other objects not of type T that appear before the object of type T will be added to the input buffer. A ClassNotFoundException is thrown when the class specified by the parameter c does not exist. This exception should never be thrown, unless the class specified is not accessible in runtime.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the object receive
        Parameters:
        c - The class with type T
        Returns:
        The next object of type T
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - See ObjectInputStream.readObject()
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - If the class specified by T does not exist

      • writeAll

        public void writeAll(java.util.Collection<? extends java.io.Serializable> objects)
              throws java.io.IOException

        Writes all objects specified by the parameters. First, the size of the objects is written. Next, each object is written. Then the stream is flushed. Should be used in conjunction with readAll(Class).

        Parameters:
        objects - The objects to be written.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - ObjectOutputStream.writeUnshared(Object)

      • write

        public void write(java.io.Serializable serializable)
           throws java.io.IOException

        Writes an object through the socket. The object must implement serializable, such that serialization can occur. The stream is then flushed.

        See also ObjectOutputStream.writeUnshared(Object)

        Parameters:
        serializable - The object
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an error occurred

      • getSocket
